meanings.sent1: The thunder made a loud crack in the sky.
meanings.sent2: I heard a crack when the glass broke.
meanings.sent3: The crack of the whip startled the horses.
meanings.sent4: The crack of dawn signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The crack of the bat echoed through the stadium.

meanings.sent1: I found a small crack in the wall.
meanings.sent2: The door had a crack where the light shone through.
meanings.sent3: The crack in the door was just big enough for the cat to squeeze through.
meanings.sent4: The crack in the sidewalk seemed to lead to another world.
meanings.sent5: The crack in the ice was too thin to walk on.

meanings.definition: A break or fracture in something
meanings.sent1: The crack in the vase was barely visible.
meanings.sent2: He noticed a crack in the mirror after dropping it.
meanings.sent3: The crack in the sidewalk looked like a smile.
meanings.sent4: The crack in the wall revealed a hidden compartment.
meanings.sent5: The crack in the ceiling grew larger over time.

meanings.definition: To break or cause to break without complete separation
meanings.sent1: She tried to crack the nut open with a nutcracker.
meanings.sent2: He managed to crack the code after hours of work.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally cracked the egg into the bowl.
meanings.sent4: The detective finally cracked the case after months of investigation.
meanings.sent5: The ice cracked under the weight of the skater.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden, sharp noise
meanings.sent1: The branches cracked under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent2: The fire crackled and popped in the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: She cracked her knuckles before starting the test.
meanings.sent4: The ice cracked as the temperature dropped.
meanings.sent5: The whip cracked in the air before striking the ground.

meanings.definition: To solve a problem or figure something out
meanings.sent1: He managed to crack the safe's combination.
meanings.sent2: She cracked the mystery wide open with her deduction.
meanings.sent3: I need to crack this math problem before the test.
meanings.sent4: The team worked together to crack the code.
meanings.sent5: After hours of brainstorming, she finally cracked the puzzle.

meanings.sent1: He cracked the whip to start the race.
meanings.sent2: The batter cracked the ball out of the park.
meanings.sent3: She cracked the door open to peek inside.
meanings.sent4: The hammer cracked the rock into pieces.
meanings.sent5: The thunder cracked loudly in the stormy sky.
